screensframework

Class AddFilmListingsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • screensframework.AddFilmListingsController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable, ControlledScreen, StaffToolbar

    public class AddFilmListingsController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, ControlledScreen, StaffToolbar
    FXML Controller class for the add film listings page. This page allows the employee to add film listings of a selected title. Listings are generated by selecting a title, a date from 'Datepicker' and adding timings from a pre-defined list of times. When the page is loaded, the list of films and timings are automatically loaded. THe listings are based on the object class of the same name. When user add listings, the entered data is passed to textfilemanager methods which then adds the data to the database. Feedback to the user is also provided.
    Author:
    Fraz Ahmad

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        Initialises the controller class for the add films listing page. Using getFilmTitles method from the textfilemanager class, a list of films are generated and added to the film selector. This is also identical for the list of film timings.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

      • addFilmListing

        private void addFilmListing(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new film listing based on user's action. The listing object is used to model the data to be inputed into the database. The values are then transferred to the textfilemanager. A new showingID is generated by finding the number of showings, then adding 1.
        Parameters:
        event - - User pressed add film listing
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - errors in getting/entering into database

      • showingTimeIsFree

        public boolean showingTimeIsFree(java.lang.String date,
                                 java.lang.String time)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Checks if the showing time is free.
        Parameters:
        date - Selected date for new showing
        time - Selected time for new showing
        Returns:
        True if there is no showing in the database for the selected date and time. False if there is currently a showing at the selected date and time.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the database file cannot be found

      • readyToSelect

        public boolean readyToSelect()
        Checks if the all the fields are entered before data is passed into the database. This prevents against unnecessary methods.
        Returns:
        True if something has been selected in each of the "Select film", "Select date" and "Select time" of showing. Will return false if any one of these has been left empty.
